009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.awt.Shape;
015import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
016import java.util.Locale;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
022import imagingbook.common.hough.HoughLine;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
024import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * This class represents an algebraic line of the form A x + B y + C = 0.
029 * Instances are immutable and normalized such that ||(A,B)|| = 1. See Sec. 10.1
030 * and Appendix F.1 of [1] for details.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
034 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
035 * </p>
036 * 
037 * @author WB
038 * @version 2022/11/18
039 */
040public class AlgebraicLine implements ShapeProducer, Primitive2d {
041        
042        public final double A, B, C;
043        
044        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
045
046        /**
047         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicLine} instance with parameters A, B, C.
048         * @param A line parameter A
049         * @param B line parameter B
050         * @param C line parameter C
051         */
052        public AlgebraicLine(double A, double B, double C) {
053                double norm = Math.sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
054                if (isZero(norm)) {
055                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("A and B may not both be zero");
056                }
057                this.A = A / norm;      // don't switch sign here since this messes up signed point distance calculation
058                this.B = B / norm;
059                this.C = C / norm;
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Constructor.  Creates a {@link AlgebraicLine} instance from a 
064         * parameter vector [A, B, C].
065         * @param p parameter vector [A, B, C]
066         */
067        public AlgebraicLine(double[] p) {
068                this(p[0], p[1], p[2]);
069        }
070        
071        
072        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
073        
074        /**
075         * Creates a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance from a given
076         * start point and orientation vector.
077         * For a point on the left side of the line (looking along the direction
078         * vector), the value returned by {@link #getSignedDistance(Pnt2d)} is positive
079         * and negative for points on the right side.
080         * 
081         * @param s start point
082         * @param v orientation vector
083         * @return a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
084         */
085        public static AlgebraicLine from(double[] s, double[] v) {
086                double a = -v[1];
087                double b = v[0];
088                double c = v[1] * s[0] - v[0] * s[1];
089                return new AlgebraicLine(a, b, c);
090        }
091        
092        /**
093         * Creates a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance from a given
094         * {@link ParametricLine}.
095         * 
096         * @param pl a {@link ParametricLine}
097         * @return a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
098         */
099        public static AlgebraicLine from(ParametricLine pl) {
100                return AlgebraicLine.from(pl.getS(), pl.getV());
101        }
102        
103        /**
104         * Creates a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance from two given
105         * points. The direction of the line is from the first
106         * to the second point.
107         * 
108         * @param p0 first point
109         * @param p1 second point
110         * @return a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
111         */
112        public static AlgebraicLine from(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1) {
113                double[] s = p0.toDoubleArray();
114                double[] v = p1.minus(p0).toDoubleArray();
115                return AlgebraicLine.from(s, v);
116        }
117        
118        /**
119         * Creates a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance from a given
120         * {@link SlopeInterceptLine}.
121         * Note: This is trivial, since {@link SlopeInterceptLine} is 
122         * a (restricted) {@link AlgebraicLine} itself.
123         * 
124         * @param sil a {@link SlopeInterceptLine}
125         * @return a new {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
126         */
127        public static AlgebraicLine from(SlopeInterceptLine sil) {
128//              double a = sil.getK();
129//              double c = sil.getD();
130//              return new AlgebraicLine(a, -1, c);     
131                return new AlgebraicLine(sil.A, sil.B, sil.C);  
132        }
133        
134        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
135        
136        /**
137         * Returns the algebraic line parameters [A, B, C].
138         * @return algebraic line parameters
139         */
140        public final double[] getParameters() {
141                return new double[] {A, B, C};
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * Returns the x-coordinate of the reference point.
146         * For a {@link AlgebraicLine}, the result is always zero.
147         * Inheriting classes (like {@link HoughLine}) override this method.
148         * 
149         * @return the x-coordinate reference
150         */
151        public double getXref() {
152                return 0.0;
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Returns the y-coordinate of the reference point.
157         * For a {@link AlgebraicLine}, the result is always zero.
158         * Inheriting classes (like {@link HoughLine}) override this method.
159         * 
160         * @return the y-coordinate reference
161         */
162        public double getYref() {
163                return 0.0;
164        }
165        
166        // other methods ------------------------------------------
167        
168        /**
169         * Returns the orthogonal distance between this line and the point (x, y).
170         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
171         * (x, y) is located. It is assumed that the line is normalized, i.e.,
172         * ||(a,b)|| = 1.
173         * 
174         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
175         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
176         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
177         */
178        public double getDistance(double x, double y) {
179                return Math.abs(getSignedDistance(x, y));
180        }
181        
182        /**
183         * Returns the orthogonal (unsigned) distance between this line and the point p. The
184         * result is always non-negative.
185         * 
186         * @param p point position.
187         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point p.
188         */
189        @Override
190        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
191                return Math.abs(getSignedDistance(p));
192        }
193        
194        /**
195         * Returns the orthogonal (signed) distance between this line and the point (x, y).
196         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
197         * (x, y) is located. It is assumed that the line is normalized, i.e.,
198         * ||(A,B)|| = 1.
199         * 
200         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
201         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
202         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
203         */
204        public double getSignedDistance(double x, double y) {
205                return (A * (x - this.getXref()) + B * (y - this.getYref()) + C);
206        }
207        
208        /**
209         * Returns the orthogonal (signed) distance between this line and the specified point.
210         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
211         * (the point is located. It is assumed that the line is normalized, i.e.,
212         * ||(A,B)|| = 1.
213         * @param p a 2D point
214         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point
215         */
216        public double getSignedDistance(Pnt2d p) {
217                return getSignedDistance(p.getX(), p.getY());
218        }
219        
220        
221        /**
222         * Returns the point on the line that is closest to the specified
223         * 2D point. The line is assumed to be normalized.
224         * 
225         * @param p an arbitrary 2D point
226         * @return the closest line point
227         */
228        public Pnt2d getClosestLinePoint(Pnt2d p) {
229                final double s = 1.0; // 1.0 / (sqr(a) + sqr(b)); // assumed to be normalized
230                final double xr = this.getXref();
231                final double yr = this.getYref();
232                double xx = p.getX() - xr;
233                double yy = p.getY() - yr;
234                double x0 = xr + s * (sqr(B) * xx - A * B * yy - A * C);
235                double y0 = yr + s * (sqr(A) * yy - A * B * xx - B * C);
236                return PntDouble.from(x0, y0);
237        }       
238
239        /**
240         * Calculates the sum of squared distances between this line
241         * and a given array of 2D points.
242         * 
243         * @param points an array of points
244         * @return the sum of squared distances
245         */
246        public double getSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
247                double sum2 = 0;
248                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
249                        sum2 = sum2 + sqr(getDistance(p));
250                }
251                return sum2;
252        }
253        
254        /**
255         * Finds the intersection point between this line and
256         * another {@link AlgebraicLine}. Returns {@code null} 
257         * if the two lines are parallel.
258         * 
259         * @param l2 another {@link AlgebraicLine}
260         * @return the intersection point or {@code null} if lines are parallel
261         */
262        public Pnt2d intersect(AlgebraicLine l2) {
263                AlgebraicLine l1 = this;        
264                double det = l1.A * l2.B - l2.A * l1.B;
265                if (isZero(det)) {
266                        return null;
267                }
268                else {
269                        double x = (l1.B * l2.C - l2.B * l1.C) / det;
270                        double y = (l2.A * l1.C - l1.A * l2.C) / det;
271                        return Pnt2d.from(x, y);
272                }
273        }
274        
275        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
276        
277        @Override
278        public Shape getShape(double length) {
279                double xRef = this.getXref();
280                double yRef = this.getYref();
281//              double angle = Math.atan2(this.B, this.A);      //this.getAngle();
282                double radius = -this.C;                                        //this.getRadius();
283                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
284                double dx = this.A;                                             // Math.cos(angle);     
285                double dy = this.B;                                                     // Math.sin(angle);
286                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
287                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
288                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
289                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
290                double x1 = x0 + dy * length;
291                double y1 = y0 - dx * length;
292                double x2 = x0 - dy * length;
293                double y2 = y0 + dx * length;
294                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
295                path.moveTo(x1, y1);
296                path.lineTo(x2, y2);
297                return path;
298        }
299        
300        /**
301         * Returns a {@link Shape} for this line to be drawn in a canvas of the
302         * specified size. Since an algebraic line is of infinite extent, we need
303         * to know the drawing size. The returned line segment is sufficiently long 
304         * to cover the entire canvas, i.e., both end points are outside the
305         * canvas.
306         *
307         * @param width the width of the drawing canvas
308         * @param height the height of the drawing canvas
309         * @return a {@link Shape} instance for this line
310         */
311        public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
312                double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height));
313                return this.getShape(length);
314        }
315        
316//      public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
317//              HoughLine hl = new HoughLine(this, 0.5 * width, 0.5 * height, 0);
318//              return hl.getShape(width, height);
319//              
320//      }
321        
322        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
323        
324        @Override
325        public boolean equals(Object other) {
326                if (this == other) {
327                        return true;
328                }
329                if (other instanceof AlgebraicLine) {
330                        return this.equals((AlgebraicLine) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
331                }
332                else {
333                        return false;
334                }
335        }
336        
337        // TODO: this should be easier to do if parameters are normalized
338        /**
339         * Checks if this {@link AlgebraicLine} is equal to another {@link AlgebraicLine}.
340         * 
341         * @param other another {@link AlgebraicLine}
342         * @param tolerance the maximum deviation
343         * @return true if both lines are equal
344         */
345        public boolean equals(AlgebraicLine other, double tolerance) {
346                AlgebraicLine L1 = this;
347                AlgebraicLine L2 = other;
348                // get two different points on L1:
349                Pnt2d xA = L1.getClosestLinePoint(PntDouble.ZERO);
350                Pnt2d xB = PntDouble.from(xA.getX() - L1.B, xA.getY() + L1.A);
351                // check if both points are on L2 too:
352                return (isZero(L2.getDistance(xA), tolerance) && isZero(L2.getDistance(xB), tolerance));
353        }
354        
355        @Override
356        public String toString() {
357                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
358//              return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <a=%.3f, b=%.3f, c=%.3f>",
359                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s<" + fStr + ", " + fStr + ", " + fStr + ">",
360                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), A, B, C);
361        }
362
363}
364
